Introduction

Installation

  1. Download the latest stable Amon Lite version from [https://github.com/martinrusev/amonlite/downloads](https://github.com/martinrusev/amonlite/downloads), untar and install the package with sudo python setup.py install
  2. Install the prequisite packages - gcc, sysstat, python-dev, on RPM based distributions, the package is called python-devel
  3. Copy the configuration file from https://raw.github.com/martinrusev/amonlite/master/config/amonlite.conf to /etc/amonlite.conf
  4. Copy the system info collect daemon from https://raw.github.com/martinrusev/amonlite/master/contrib/amond to /etc/init.d/amond
  5. Copy the web application daemon from https://raw.github.com/martinrusev/amonlite/master/contrib/amonlite to /etc/init.d/amon
  6. Make the daemons executable with sudo chmod +x /etc/init.d/amond /etc/init.d/amon
  7. Create a directory for Amon Lite specific log files sudo mkdir /usr/local/amonlite

Installing Mongodb

Amon Lite stores all the information in a Mongo database. If you already have MongoDB installed, skip this step. You can install Mongo, following this guide: http://docs.mongodb.org/manual/installation

  1. Finally start the Amon Lite collector daemon with sudo /etc/init.d/amond start
  2. Add *amond* to the list of processes that boot with the operating system: 
    	
# For Debian based distributions	
sudo update-rc.d amond defaults

# For RPM based distributions
sudo chkconfig --add amond
# Uninstall First we need to stop the daemons for amon sudo /etc/init.d/amond stop # If the web application is running sudo /etc/init.d/amonlite stop The next step is to remove all the daemons from the init directory sudo rm /etc/init.d amond /etc/init.d/amonlite To avoid OS bugs on boot, we have to remove the procesess from the boot list: # On Debian based distributions sudo update-rc.d -f amond remove # On RPM based distributions chkconfig --del amond And our last step is to uninstall Amon Lite itself and to remove the Mongo directories pip uninstall amonlite pymongo tornado # If you don't have pip installed on your system sudo easy_install pip
